data.title: Fix warnings about implicit conversion loses integer precision
data.body:
I get two warnings when compiling libcocos2d for Mac using Xcode 8.2.1 and this patch fixes the warnings below.

```
cocos/3d/CCTerrain.cpp:439:37: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_type' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'unsigned int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
cocos/3d/CCTerrain.cpp:453:37: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_type' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'unsigned int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
```

data.title: Fix misspelling of setFirstFocusedWidget function
data.body:
This PR corrects a misspelled word `Focsued` to `Focused`. `Widget` class uses Pimpl idiom to hide the implementation of `FocusNavigationController` class so this change doesn't break public API.
Thanks!

data.title: Fix typo in variable name
data.body: `backGroundSelected` parameter is seemingly misspelled as `backGroundSeleted`. This patch fixes it.

data.title: Add a preprocessor test to disable the logs even in debug.
data.body: Having asserts enabled in debug builds is nice to find various coding mistakes but having a lot of logs can be annoying. This commit adds a preprocessor test allowing to turn off the logs and keep the asserts in debug builds.

data.title: Allow to unbind asynchronous texture loading callback with a custom key.
data.body:
In order to unbind the callback passed to
`cocos2d::TextureCache::addImageAsync(path, callback)`, one has to
call `cocos2d::TextureCache::unbindImageAsync(path)`. In the cases
where the loading of the same texture is requested from several sources
simultaneously, then none of the source can unbind its own callback
unambiguously.
    
This commit adds an overload of the `addImageAsync` function taking an extra
argument identifying the callback, thus allowing to unbind it unambiguously
in cases where the loading of path is requested by several sources
simultaneously.

data.title: Prevent the compilation of NavMeshTest if CC_USE_PHYSICS=0.
data.body: Please merge this commit fixing compilation errors in `NavMeshTast` when `CC_USE_PHYSICS=0`.

data.title: Laggy framerate on iPhone 7
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: iPhone 7 and iPhone 6
- Xcode version: 8.21

I tested our cocos2d-x v3.13 game on iPhone 7 device. It Sometimes passes 50 fps, while other iOS devices (including iPhone 6 or below) ran very smoothly. I tried everything in my code but no result.
It seems iPhone 7 runs other processes which eats much cpu. when i run QuickPlayer to record video on iPhone 7 the game made more smoothly.
Can anything be done about this issue?

data.title: Fixed Scheduler bug occured when unschedule target during update.
data.body:
After #17198 
Sometimes, unscheduled target's update function is called.
When one target unscheduled its next target in scheduler's doubly linked list, uscheduled next target's update function will be called.
Please refer the test case.

data.title: Fix typo in function name
data.body: This PR fixes a small typo with `HttpClient::lazyInitThreadSemaphore`:  `Semphore` to `Semaphore`. The function is private so it doesn't break backwards compatibility. Thanks!

data.title: Fix typos in comments and strings
data.body: This pull request fixes several minor typos in comments and strings.

data.title: cocos2d: CCSpriteFrameCache: Trying to use file perfectBounce.png as texture, cocos2d: CCSpriteFrameCache: Couldn't load texture
data.body: - cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.13.1 - devices test on: running build on simulator iphone 6s - developing environments - NDK version: android-ndk-r13b - Xcode version: Version 8.1 (8B62) - VS version: - browser type and version: Steps to Reproduce: 1. Running the build from xcode, getting exception when initializing a new scene which uses sprite frame cache. 2. Have a spritesheet generated using texture packer, perfectBounce.png and perfectBounce.plist. Both files are present under the Resources directory in xcode. Screenshots attached for the debug console.

使用--no-native生成的项目无法使用问题
data.body:
### 我用如下命令生成一个测试项目
```
cocos new -l lua --no-native ~/Documents/Hello
```

### 然后cd到目录下使用：
```
cocos run -p osx 
```

### 报错：
```
没有可用的平台。
```

data.title: Fix variable name typo
data.body: There is a small typo in a variable name inside `Sprite3D::AsyncLoadParam`.

data.title: Correct spelling of "intersect"
data.body:
This PR corrects the spelling of the word `intersect`:
- `getInsterctPointWithRay` -> `getIntersectPointWithRay`
- `getInsterctPoint` -> `getIntersectPoint`
- `interscetPoint` -> `intersectPoint`
- `interScetPoint` -> `intersectPoint`

It also keeps misspelled functions as a deprecated API for backwards compatibility.

data.title: crash on honor 3c android version 4.2.2
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: honor 3c android 4.2.2
- developing environments
   - NDK version: ndk r11
   and i had tried ndk r10c r10b
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. cocos compile -p android then run on honor 3c android 4.2.2 and it crashed
2.code desc when i send http request it will crash like this
xhr:send(json.encode(sendData))
3. logcat flow
01-15 13:16:35.260: D/cocos2d-x debug info(6589): In the constructor of HttpClient!
01-15 13:16:35.296: W/dalvikvm(6589): dvmFindClassByName rejecting 'org/cocos2dx/lib/Cocos2dxHttpURLConnection'
01-15 13:16:35.488: A/libc(6589): Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x00000000 (code=1), thread 6
@minggo
